section.title: Repository
section.para: CentOS uses an "yum" based repository system. It uses it using the "yum" tools.
In order to add the Eclipse SCADA repository to your system create a file called /etc/yum.repos.d/EclipseSCADA.repo with the following content:
You can verify that the repository was added using the following command: yum list "org.eclipse.scada*"

You should get an output like: Available Packages org.eclipse.scada.noarch 0.2.0 EclipseSCADA org.eclipse.scada-centos6.noarch 0.2.0 EclipseSCADA org.eclipse.scada-suse.i386 0.2.0 EclipseSCADA org.eclipse.scada-suse.x86_64 0.2.0 EclipseSCADA org.eclipse.scada.base.p2-incubation.noarch 0.2.0 EclipseSCADA org.eclipse.scada.core.p2-incubation.noarch 0.2.0 EclipseSCADA org.eclipse.scada.deploy.p2-incubation.noarch 0.2.0 EclipseSCADA org.eclipse.scada.deploy.p2director-incubation.i386 0.2.0 EclipseSCADA org.eclipse.scada.deploy.p2director-incubation.x86_64 0.2.0 EclipseSCADA org.eclipse.scada.external.p2-incubation.noarch 0.2.0 EclipseSCADA org.eclipse.scada.p2.noarch 0.2.0 EclipseSCADA org.eclipse.scada.protocols.p2-incubation.noarch 0.2.0 EclipseSCADA org.eclipse.scada.utils.p2-incubation.noarch 0.2.0 EclipseSCADA
